name: Paris International Exhibition 1905
obverse: A standing woman wearing a toga holds a hammer in her left hand. A young boy holds a basket of wheat up to the woman who has her right hand extended over the basket. Behind her is a sun on the horizon and around her are plants and instruments of art and industry.
reverse: The coat of arms of Paris with a place for the inscription of a name below.
description: Not much information exists about this medal.
The inscription indicates that it was made for the "Paris International Exhibition" in 1905 but no such exhibition was actually held.
There was, however, a world fair held in Liege in 1905.
